description: Lemon Ricotta Pasta is light, fresh, and quick to prepare, making it the perfect pasta for weeknight dinners in the summer.
name: Lemon Ricotta Pasta
recipeIngredient: 1/4 tsp freshly cracked black pepper (or to taste) ($0.02)
1 pinch crushed red pepper (or to taste) ($0.02)

recipeInstructions.text: Zest and juice the lemon. You'll need about 1/2 tsp zest and 1 Tbsp lemon juice.
Cook the pasta according to the package directions (boil for 7-10 minutes, or until tender). Before draining, reserve about 1 cup of the starchy water from the pot.
Place the frozen peas in the colander before draining the pasta so the pasta will thaw the peas as it drains.
Add the butter and minced garlic to a large skillet and saut√© over medium heat for 1-2 minutes, or just until the garlic is fragrant.
Add the drained pasta and peas, and about 1/2 cup of the starchy pasta cooking water to the skillet with the butter and garlic. Stir to combine, then turn off the heat.

Add the ricotta, Parmesan, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, and 1/2 teaspoon lemon zest to the skillet. Stir until everything is well combined, the residual heat from the skillet and pasta have warmed the ricotta, and the ricotta has formed a creamy sauce. Add more of the warm reserved pasta water if needed.
Season the pasta with salt, pepper, and crushed red pepper to taste. Serve warm.
